intro: Comanthera paepalophylla subsp. paepalophylla, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its striking white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows from a bulbous stem and has narrow, grass-like leaves adapted to conserve water. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it well-suited for survival in harsh, dry environments.
